doc.title: Q2/1H broadly in line, EBITDA guide lowered due to FX, remains a special sit into YE
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-28/Delivery Hero Q21H broadly in line EBITDA guide lowered due to FX remains a special sit into YEDelivery Hero Q21H broadl_2025-08-28

passages.text: Q2 / 1H results broadly in line on aggregate basis. GMV guidance not moved much when adjusting for nuance around discontinued ops. EBITDA and FCF guide lowered due to FX. Doesn't materially change fundamental story - stock is a special sit with potential catalysts to crystallise value upcoming (OW)

Q2 variance. 1) Group GMV growth c. \(+7\%\) at constant FX ex hyperinflationary accounting (vs Q1 \(+8\%\) ), \(+11\%\) like- for- like basis vs \(10\%\) in Q1 (excluding discontinued ops) and \(+3\%\) on a reported basis. This compares to cons. \(+3\%\) and Barc \(+2\%\) on the same basis.
At constant FX in Q2.

- MENA grew \(+22\%\) yoy in Q2 vs Q1 \((+29\%)\) , Q4'24 \((+34\%)\) , Q3 \((+30\%)\) , Q2 \((+28\%)\) . Noteworthy that Talabat grew the same in Q2 at constant FX as in Q1 so something in MENA has slowed. The company talks about KSA still growing orders \(>20\%\) (similar to Q1) but isn't more specific in terms of GMV trends and there is no comment on Turkey.- Europe grew \(+12\%\) yoy in Q2 vs Q1 \((+12\%)\) , Q4'24 \((+17\%)\) , Q3 \((+21\%)\) , Q2 \((+19\%)\) .- Asia down \((-4\%)\) yoy in Q2 vs Q1 \((-8\%)\) , Q4'24 \((-8\%)\) , Q3 \((-3\%)\) , Q2 \((-5\%)\) . Within this Foodpanda growing (first time in a while) and Baemin (SK) making progress with accelerated rollout of own-delivery.- Americas grew \(+15\%\) yoy in Q2 vs Q1 \((+32\%)\) , Q4'24 \((+25\%)\) , Q3 \((+21\%)\) , Q2 \((+14\%)\) - Integrated Vertical grew \(+25\%\) yoy vs Q1 \((+30\%)\) , Q4'24 \((+32\%)\) , Q3 \((+28\%)\) , Q2 \((+31\%)\)
4) Group FCF in H1, ex one offs, was -£8m.
This research report has been prepared in whole or in part by equity research analysts based outside the US who are not registered/qualified as research analysts with FINRA.
Please see analyst certifications and important disclosures beginning on page 5. Completed: 28- Aug- 25, 06:44 GMT Released: 28- Aug- 25, 06:45 GMT Restricted - External
Price (27- Aug- 25) EUR 23.44 Potential Upside/Downside +95.0% Source: Bloomberg, Barclays Research

Guidance tweaks; mind the nuance in the language. 1) Group GMV is now expected to grow at the upper end of the previously guided range of \(8 - 10\%\) yoy like- for- like basis at constant FX and ex hyperinflationary accounting. The only nuance is that the footnote in the Q2 deck suggests the guide is also now excluding discontinued ops (a few small countries in Europe, Thailand in Q2 and a legacy directory service in Spain and Korea). This footnote wasn't present in the Q1 deck and so it appears the basis of the guidance has slightly changed. In 1H, the delta of these factors was worth 2pts to growth. We assume the delta is similar in 2H as the company laps through closures in Europe but has to absorb full period of Thailand and directories in Korea and Spain. So we would assume the impact for the year could still be 2pts. And so, adjusting for this, the clean guidance looks to be broadly the same / 1pt lower than the mid point of the prior. On a lfl basis, the company grew \(10.5\%\) in 1H and so the guide infers c1pt slower in 2H. We'd assume slowing in Q3 (tough comp in Korea) and reacceleration in Q4. 2) Group Revenue is forecast to grow \(22 - 24\%\) yoy (vs. \(17 - 19\%\) prior). Again the basis has changed a bit to now adjust for discontinued ops. We assume the main reason is the accelerated 1P roll out in Korea. 3) Adj. EBITDA has been revised down to €900-940m (vs. €975-1,025m prior). 4) Free Cash Flow revised down to over €120m (vs. over €200m). The company attributes the EBITDA and FCF downgrade mainly to FX with the strengthening of the EUR vs USD- pegged currencies and KWR, negatively impacting EBITDA by \(€110m\) and Free Cash Flow by \(€80m\) . Company mentioned excluding FX headwind it would have been on track to meet its prior FY25 guidance (in fact maths suggests slightly ahead). It is a bit surprising to us that the guide has only been adjusted now given the move in the EUR vs the \(\) already had happened when Q1 was reported.

Provisions and contingent liabilities. Continent liabilities are up to €520- 860m (still moving to employment model in Spain during 1H; now done) vs the €440- 770m at FY. Provisions down to €618m vs €900m due to the release of the provision related to the Glovo EC dispute (still on balance sheet in other financial liabilities).
Conference call at 1pm UKT (here)

Overweight - The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Equal Weight - The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Underweight - The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Positive - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are improving.
Neutral - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.
Negative - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are deteriorating.

Valuation Methodology: We value Delivery Hero on a SOTP given the regions have different market positions and growth rates. We use a DCF for each region (2- 4% terminal growth and varying WACCs, factoring in higher discount rates for emerging markets). We use a 0.2x multiple for the Integrated Verticals segment (Dark Stores) We then add in a value for tax losses and the minority stakes.

Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Valuation and Price Target: To the downside, the main risks are that (1) competition increases across the various markets (both in food delivery and grocery) and (2) capital allocation gets more complicated.
Third Party Distribution: Any views expressed in this communication are solely those of Barclays and have not been adopted or endorsed by any third party distributor.

Sustainable Investing Related Research: There is currently no globally accepted framework or definition (legal, regulatory or otherwise) of, nor market consensus as to what constitutes a 'sustainable', 'ESG', 'green', 'climate- friendly' or an equivalent company, investment, strategy or consideration or what precise attributes are required to be eligible to be categorised by such terms. This means there are different ways to evaluate a company or an investment and so different values may be placed on certain sustainability credentials as well as adverse ESG- related impacts of companies and ESG controversies. The evolving nature of sustainable investing considerations, models and methodologies means it can be challenging to definitively and universally classify a company or investment under a sustainable investing label and there may be areas where such companies and investments could improve or where adverse ESG- related impacts or ESG controversies exist. The evolving nature of sustainable finance related regulations and the development of jurisdiction- specific regulatory criteria also means that there is likely to be a degree of divergence as to the interpretation of such terms in the market. We expect industry guidance, market practice, and regulations in this field to continue to evolve.
